job_title: Outgoing Global Talent Team Leader in Hong Kong
pros: Able to lead large teams and promote products. Sales skills learnt and product skills developed.

review_title: Good grind, find better way out
pros: good networking in a cross-uni environment
cons: stress, unpaid, and toxic working culture
Students run organization, you may not really be engaged in that

pros: Enthusiastic, Youthful, Energetic and Entrepreneurial. You will just miss the fast-paced working team environment there with young people!
cons: Sustainability remains an issue as every year the management team shift and strategy might not continue that easily.

job_title: Exchange Development Officer in Hong Kong
pros:
1. Exchange opportunities (mainly Europe and Asia)
2. International network (you can meet ppl from around the world, mainly undergraduates)
cons:
1. Heavy workload (sometimes)

It depends much on which team you are in. If you are in a team and you are not interested, that will be an awful experience.

job_title: Global Sourcing Talent Officer in Hong Kong
pros: AIESEC has a very positive culture. It provides opportunity for leadership development and global exchange.
cons: As a student, it takes time to complete AIESEC work.

pros: Purpose-driven, learning-driven, practical experience, leadership, teamwork
cons: Not that I can think of.
